title: Gravity - Flow
description:
72 Digital Tapes, 1600 ft of 8mm film, 2 stolen cameras, 4 countries, 1 theme.

The year was 2003. The skateboard industry was changing, style was on the forefront and progression was the name of the game. Flow was the first full-length DVD produced by Gravity Skateboards, way back then, yet the skating is as relative today as ever.

title: Powell Peralta - Axe Rated
description: In this 1988 promotional video, which was never released to the general public, Ms. Kathryn, a "fashion simulator", takes viewers through Powell Peralta's product line to be released the following year. Includes footage of the Animal Chin ramp build, 1987 Savannah Slamma, and a party at the Powell Peralta ramp before the opening of the Powell Skate Zone in 1991.

soundtracks.track: Johnny Rad - Twist And Shout (Johnny's Version)
Odd Man Out - Trial By Fire

title: Levi’s® - Skateboarding In La Paz
description:
In April of 2014, Levi's® Skateboarding joined Bolivian skater Milton Arellano in reuniting with the endboss projects crew from Hannover, along with over a 100 skateboarders and builders from around the world, to build a public skatepark in La Paz, Bolivia. See professional skateboarders Marius Syvanen, David Gravette, Josh Matthews, Joey Pepper, Chet Childress, and Al Partanen live, work, and skate the Pura Pura skatepark three miles up in the sky.

Directed by Simon Weyhe
Assistant Director: Mathias Nyholm Schmidt
Produced by Levi's Skateboarding®
Cinematography by Simon Weyhe & Mathias Nyholm Schmidt
Additional Camera by Kasper Hornbek Nielsen & Milton Arellano
Edited by Simon Weyhe
Additional Editing by Mathias Nyholm Schmidt
Music by Anders Christophersen, WSLS Records

title: Heirloom
description: Filmed mostly in Rochester, New York as well as other locations in New York state and abroad. The DVD release came with 30 minutes of bonus footage and a zine assembled by Kyle Hofsass, with photos provided by Kyle Hofsass, Boris Sapozhnikov, Michael Faller, Jon Spitzer, Daniel Frank, Frank Branca.

title: Is This The Place?
description:
Welcome to Tor Ström's newest and possibly his best work, "Is This The Place?". A video project that is connected to the newest issue 666 of Place Magazine "Tao's Place". This video has it all, a great soundtrack, nice lens work and Heitor da Silva, Ville Wester, Vincent Huhta, Sondre Mortensen, Jamie Platt, Charlie Birch and many others in the mix. Enjoy.

We would like to thank Nike SB, Vans, Polar & Bryggeriet for supporting this project. 

Additional filming Love Öhling.
